body.name: BLACK+DECKER® One Step Steam Iron with EvenSteam Stainless Steel Soleplates and SmartSteam Control, Grey

features: EvenSteam Stainless Steel Soleplate: Designed to disperse a more even flow of steam across the soleplate from tip to heel.*
Enhanced SmartSteam Control: Single control regulates steam automatically based on temperature setting.

Spray Mist Button and Burst of Steam Functions: The side-by-side buttons provide a comprehensive control of moisture — one button offers a gentle spray mist, the other a burst of steam for fast, easy wrinkle removal.
Cord Reel: Button-operated and spring-loaded, the cord unreels and retracts quickly for easy use and storage.

3-Way Auto Shutoff: The iron automatically switches to Auto-Shut-Off mode and stops heating when left inactive for 30 seconds on the soleplate or side, and 8 minutes on the heel rest. Simply move the iron to resume ironing safely.
Comfort Grip Handle: The handle design helps make longer ironing tasks comfortable.
body.description: Take a step toward fighting stubborn wrinkles. The BLACK+DECKER® One Step Steam iron features an EvenSteam Stainless Steel Soleplate which is designed to disperse a more even flow of steam across the soleplate from tip to heel. * With Improved SmartSteam™ Control, a single control dial regulates steam automatically based on temperature setting for different fabric types. For comprehensive control of moisture during ironing, the Spray Mist and Burst of Steam functions are side by side. The Comfort Grip™ handle helps make longer ironing tasks comfortable. Button-operated and spring-loaded, the iron’s cord unreels and retracts quickly for easy use and storage. From the #1 brand in irons**, the BLACK+DECKER® One Step Steam iron makes it convenient to get professional-level results on everything from slacks and shirts to drapes and curtains.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great iron, great price, light!
reviews.reviewText: I tried several irons and finally found this one. It is just right, not too light, not too heavy and has a power steam button that is great! It is larger in size than my previous iron, but works great!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Pretty good for the price.
reviews.reviewText: Fairly basic iron, for the twenty bucks I paid I think it’s worth it. I wear shirts to work so I like them well ironed and this unit replaced an older B&D unit that eventually bit the dust after twenty years!I like the retractable cord, although I suspect it will fail before the rest of the iron. The sole plate is metal not ceramic which I prefer. It produces a fair amount of steam.A good buy for a reasonable price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Cord is a problem
reviews.reviewText: Loved this iron at first. Works great, great steam. A little heavy, but okay. However, about a month ago, the cord would not rewind, which was not a huge problem. Just an inconvenience. Then, it would only rewind partway, and not pull out properly. Left with a 6 inch cord and had to use an extension cord to use the iron. GRRRRR Any ideas or suggestions welcome Also, not a fan of the blue plastic --- looks pretty, but hard to know level of water. I need to rethink my next iron purchase carefully.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Product great, shipping not so good
reviews.reviewText: The iron was great, just what I ordered. When the first one came it was wrapped in tape that said damage. Sent it back and ordered a new one, which worked great. Did not like that it did not come in a box.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2023
reviews.reviewText: First off, I'll only buy an iron from Black & Decker-They're the best & this one is no different! I didn't know it has a retractable cord. That was a nice surprise, but sometimes it doesn't retract 100%, maybe by a few inches , so keep that in mind if it's important to you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Steams at low settings with button
reviews.reviewText: So I bought this one because someone said it never stops steaming, and I wanted an iron that had auto steam at all heat settings. This one has auto steam in the middle heat settings, which is good, but not at low settings. However, the steam button still works at low heat settings (the iron I tried before this one wouldn’t steam with the button at low settings), so I’m happy with it considering how hard it seems to be to figure out which irons auto steam or even have steam with the button at low settings. I’m too novice to know when I’d ever want to dry iron anything lol. But I like steam!!CONSThe cord does get stuck in the last foot of coiling back up into the iron, which isn’t too big a deal. And I wish there were steam holes up near the point of the plate, particularly for trying to iron a specific item that had short, pleated pieces of fabric against parts I didn’t want to iron. But I managed. For this, I should give the iron 4 stars for how it met my specific needs, but I’m not sure if other people might be REALLY glad it doesn’t have steam holes closer to the point? I was trying to achieve a thing, and I couldn’t easily, but there’s probably a trade off somewhere that I don’t have the experience to see.PROSThe heat setting dial is easy to get to and see as it’s on the top of the iron. The steam buttons are easy to press. The tank is easy to fill and empty, and I can see the water level. Oh, and I’ve had ZERO drips!!I’m definitely happy with the iron. I wanted steam. I got steam. I just have to do a little work to get the steam I want sometimes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great product and great price
reviews.reviewText: fast shipping and exactly what I wanted.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars It Doesn't Get Hot Enough!
reviews.reviewText: I don't know what it is but the irons being made today aren't made the way they use to be. The ironing soleplates are not as long and they don't heat up enough. I bought this one because I thought since the wattage was 1800, it would have higher heat, but it didn't. It's nice looking, light weight, but doesn't get hot enough to knock out wrinkles.

not at all happy with this iron. It leaks water quite badly. It was pooling under the iron and I had to keep wiping up the water from the ironing board. Returned after one use. Do not recommend this product.
La plancha es de excelente calidad, muy buena compra relación precio - calidad, sin duda nos orillamos a la excelente calidad, muy recomendable!!
